channel.title: Portal 2 or Crysis 2
channel.description:
Hey everyone I'm just about done with my new computer and I was wondering which game I should go get - Crysis 2 or Portal 2?
Portal 2 looks pretty damn sweet but once I beat the game and coop it doesn't seem like there's anything to do except play it over again.. and even though many people are complaining about how much of a let down Crysis is I'm hoping there might be some replay value in thar.
Other than that I don't really know what I should get.:mono:

item.title: Portal 2 or Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: Llewen_Ebag
item.description:
Same here.

Don’t get me wrong though, Crysis 2 stills kicks a fairly nice amount of ass and is ultimately awesome in its own right.
But still it would be Portal 2 at the end of the day.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 or Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: Awesomeness
item.description:
I would say Portal 2. I enjoyed Crysis 2 a lot, but i must say that Portal 2 is better. I would also rather play Portal 2 again a third time, than play Crysis 2 a second time. But thats just my opinion. I would say you should get both. Portal 2 is on sale at amazon right now, i would get it now if i was you.

item.title: Portal 2 or Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: Ry_amp_955_n
item.description:
I bought and played Portal 2. I was impressed and was very glad I bought the actual case and cd for it. And it’s not a “oh shoot bad gaise with gunz” game. It has PORTALS. and Funnies.

I also played Crysis2. 30 minutes in, I was yawning, “Nice Graphics, but when do i get interested and actaully begin to enjoy the game?”

Portal 2 may not look nicer, but it is deffinately better overall, and in it’s own graphical style, better.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 or Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I’m just saying, comparing Crysis 2 and Portal 2 is like comparing apples and oranges. They’re totally different games, and any opinion of which game is better or worse comes solely down to personal taste due to their extremely different play styles, stories, and game mechanics. It’s all subjective, you see.

item.title: Portal 2 or Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: DarkSoroush
item.description:
Portal 2 is answer! (In my opinion) If you are not a fan of Gun & Run!

Crysis 2 has better Graphic, But “Normal” dialogs.(I am sorry, But what the hell is a dialog like (After crashing of bridge) “Doctor we don’t have time for this.” Who the hell is she!? This seems like ****ing stereotype dialog that every funny R&G have. Or “I am prophet”) “Normal” Gameplay like every AAA R&G game. And not bad level design. Good multiplayer. Good game any way.

But take look to Portal! Amazing. Ultimately nice dialogs. Valve type story. Medium Graphic and Amazing Music, Amazing level design. Unique Game play. Never played before CO-OP. And no multiplayer.

It is your choose. You can select a “UNIQUE AND AMAZING” game. Play it for 15 hour and love it. Or select a “GOOD BUT REPETITIVE” game that you can play for 50 or more hour. Quantity or Quality?!

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 or Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
russilker:

IMO, playing the original Crysis won’t really give you a taste for what Crysis 2 is like. They’re extremely different games, and while my firm opinion is that Crysis 2 changed everything for the worse, many people believe it’s a more streamlined, enjoyable experience. Multiplayer in Crysis 2 can be imagined as Call of Duty, but with nanosuit invisibility and armor (which is actually pretty fun, for me anyways).

Point is: if you play Crysis 1 and really love it, you probably won’t enjoy Crysis 2.
If you play Crysis 1 and think its story is poor and its boring and repetitive and the nanosuit modes are overly complicated and useless, you’ll probably enjoy Crysis 2.

EDIT: Oh, and I’m playing Portal 2 right now. Freaking amazing game, definitely recommend it over Crysis 2 any day. Hell, I’d even recommend Black Ops over Crysis 2 (even though I hated Black Ops). But that’s just me.

This pretty much. I tried sooo hard to like Crysis 2. I really did.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 or Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I personally really enjoyed Crysis 2. The story by Richard Morgan was quite well written, and had some interesting things to say about transhumanism. It’s certainly worth a rental at least.

item.title: Portal 2 or Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
Plazmatic:

Actually portal 2 will end up mostly like Team fortress2, there will be tons of new maps added and player made maps, You need to look at how the Coop is set up to understand that.

Any way, Crysis 2 campaign was not as good as portals, and does not have the re-playability you think it has, the multiplayer sucks, you’d be better off with the first ones multiplayer, theres also no vehicles, and the maps are really small. ALSO only a max player count of 16

I tried applying that logic of new maps to Left 4 Dead…
It didn’t end well.

I don’t really see how not having vehicles makes multiplayer suck. They COULD have added vehicles if they wanted to. Heck, Portal 2 could have vehicles if they put the time in for it. The obvious question: Why the hell would they?

Read full topic
